trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> types to UI Automation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The element associated with this automation peer.
Gets the object that supports the specified control pattern of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
An enumeration value that specifies the control pattern.
If patternInterface is , , , or , this method returns a `this` pointer; otherwise, this method returns `null`.
Gets the total number of columns in a grid.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider> interface.
The total number of columns in a grid.
Retrieves the UI Automation provider for the specified cell.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider> interface.
The ordinal number of the row of interest.
The ordinal number of the column of interest.
The UI Automation provider for the specified cell.
Gets the total number of rows in a grid.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider> interface.
The total number of rows in a grid.
Retrieves an element by the specified property value.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IItemContainerProvider> interface.
The item in the container after which to begin the search.
The property that contains the value to retrieve.
The value to retrieve.
The first item that matches the search criterion; otherwise, `null` if no items match.
Gets the current control-specific view.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider> interface.
The value for the current view of the UI Automation element.
Retrieves a collection of control-specific view identifiers.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider> interface.
A collection of values that identifies the views available for a UI Automation element.
Retrieves the name of a control-specific view.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider> interface.
The view identifier.
A localized name for the view.
Sets the current control-specific view.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider> interface.
A view identifier.
viewId is not a member of the supported views collection.
Gets a value that specifies whether the UI Automation provider allows more than one child element to be selected concurrently.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider> interface.
`true` if multiple selection is allowed; otherwise, `false`.
Retrieves a UI Automation provider for each child element that is selected.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider> interface.
A collection of UI Automation providers.
Gets a value that specifies whether the UI Automation provider requires at least one child element to be selected.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets a collection of UI Automation providers that represents all the column headers in a table.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider> interface.
A collection of UI Automation providers.
Retrieves a collection of UI Automation providers that represents all row headers in the table.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider> interface.
A collection of UI Automation providers.
Retrieves the primary direction of traversal for the table.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider> interface.
The primary direction of traversal.
